head.title: DEPUY PLANS TO BUY ORTHOPEDIC TECHNOLOGY

hedline.hl1: DEPUY PLANS TO BUY ORTHOPEDIC TECHNOLOGY

block.p: The shares of Orthopedic Technology Inc. rose yesterday after the company said that it had agreed to be acquired by Depuy Inc., a unit of Boehringer Mannheim G.m.b.H., for $10.43 a share, or a total of $46.2 million. Orthopedic Technology stock rose 32.8 cents, to $10.313 in Nasdaq trading. Closely held Depuy, which is based in Warsaw, Ind., plans to begin a tender offer for all of Orthopedic Technology's outstanding shares. Depuy, with more than $425 million in annual revenue, manufactures and sells orthopedic products worldwide including prosthetic implants, and trauma and spinal products. Orthopedic Technology, based in Tracy, Calif., manufactures custom and off-the-shelf orthopedic products. The company had revenue of $18.4 million for the year ended Sept. 30.
